result.execSummary:
The defendant Michelle A Freund was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Theft-Business Setting >$10,000, a class G felony, Wisconsin Statutes 943.20(1)(b).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

miscConds.notes: To be paid for Woodway USA.  To be paid as a condition of probation and to be paid before costs or fines.

If discharged with outstanding financial obligations, a civil judgment shall be entered against the defendant and in favor of restitution victims and government entities for outstanding financial obligations.  Collections may include income assignment.

records.addlTxt: Character letters filed in Court on April 25, 2016 by Attorney Lowenberg.

Defendant Michelle A Freund in court with attorney Eric Daniel Lowenberg.  Barbara Ann Michaels appeared for the State of Wisconsin.   The Defendant was sentenced to the following:

Count #1:

IMPOSED AND STAYED SENTENCE OF:   

4 YEARS IMPRISONMENT.
  -  2 YEARS OF INITIAL CONFINEMENT.
  -  2 YEARS OF EXTENDED SUPERVISION;

TERM OF PROBATION:  3 YEAR(S);

CONDITIONS OF PROBATION:  
*Follow through with any treatment and/or counseling recommended by Agent;
*No contact with:  Woodway USA or its employees.
*DNA sample to be provided if not yet previously done.
*Perform 120 Hours Community Service.
*No volunteer or professional employment in any fiduciary capacity.

RESTITUTION:  $1,793.00 (to be paid to Woodway USA - to be paid as a condition of probation - restitution to be paid before costs or fines);

COURT COSTS:  $278.00 (to be paid as a condition of probation);

DNA SURCHARGE:  $250.00 (to be paid as a condition of probation);

CONDITION TIME: 6 months - non working hours.  (release for work, work search and childcare.  The Court does not grant electronic monitoring.  The Court does not authorize good time credit.  
The Defendant is to report to the Huber Facility by 5:00 p.m. on Monday, May 2, 2016.

IF REVOKED:
Defendant is not eligible for Challenge Incarceration Program.
Defendant is not eligible for Substance Abuse Program.

Felony warnings, voting rights and firearms warnings given.
Sentencing hearing at 04-25-2016 03:00 pm

records.descr: Notice and acknowledge of def voting ineligibility

records.addlTxt: with Elements of criminal offenses to which plea is being entered.

Defendant Michelle A Freund in court with attorney Eric Daniel Lowenberg.  Barbara Michaels  appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Defendant enters a guilty plea to Count 1.  Court finds defendant guilty.  Attorney Lowenberg requests sentencing be scheduled after April 10, 2016.  The State does not object.  Sentencing hearing scheduled for April 25, 2016 at 03:00 pm.
Plea/sentencing hearing at 02-29-2016 03:00 pm

Defendant Michelle A Freund in court with attorney Eric Daniel Lowenberg.  Barbara Ann Michaels appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Attorney Lowenberg requests one final adjournment until the end of February to allow for Defendant to pay additional restitution.  The State does not object to the request.   The Court schedules accordlingly.  Plea/sentencing hearing scheduled for February 29, 2016 at 03:00 pm.
Plea/sentencing hearing at 01-05-2016 02:00 pm

Defendant Michelle A Freund in court with Attorney Eric Daniel Lowenberg.  Susan L. Opper appeared for the State of Wisconsin.   Attorney Lowenberg requests a plea and sentence date.  Court adjourns.   Bail remains as fixed.  Plea/sentencing hearing scheduled for January 5, 2016 at 02:00 pm.
Hearing at 10-23-2015 01:30 pm

Defendant Michelle A Freund in court with attorney Eric Daniel Lowenberg.  Mary C. Brejcha appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Defense is requesting a date in a few weeks. Defense addresses restitution and Attorney fees. Court will give a date in a few weeks.  Hearing scheduled for October 23, 2015 at 01:30 pm.
